TIP.Definition: a useful piece of information, especially about how to do something or about the likely winner of a race or competition

PAY ATTENTION.Definition: to watch, listen to, or think about something or someone carefully or with interest

SYLLABLE.Definition: a single unit of speech, either a whole word or one of the parts into which a word can be separated, usually containing a vowel

PAGE.Definition: a side of one of the pieces of paper in a book, newspaper, or magazine, usually with a number printed on it

WAGE.Definition: a particular amount of money that is paid, usually every week, to an employee, especially one who does work that needs physical skills or strength, rather than a job needing a college education

RAGE.Definition: (a period of) extreme or violent anger

SAGE.Definition: a person, especially an old man, who is wise

HOMAGE.Definition: deep respect and often praise shown for a person or god

LEVERAGE.Definition: power to influence people and get the results you want

MILEAGE.Definition: the distance that a vehicle has traveled or the distance that it can travel using a particular amount of fuel

ADVANTAGE.Definition: a condition giving a greater chance of success

EXCEPTIONS.Definition: someone or something that is not included in a rule, group, or list or that does not behave in the expected way

GARAGE.Definition: a building where a car is kept, built next to or as part of a house

CAMOUFLAGE.Definition: the use of leaves, branches, paints, and clothes for hiding soldiers or military equipment so that they cannot be seen against the area around them

SABOTAGE.Definition: to intentionally prevent the success of a plan or action

ENGAGE.Definition: to become involved, or have contact, with someone or something
